title: More verbose errors when using DataParallel
body_html:
When I use DataParallel, I get errors like:

 File "/home/k/miniconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 224, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/k/miniconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/data_parallel.py", line 60, in forward
    outputs = self.parallel_apply(replicas, inputs, kwargs)
  File "/home/k/miniconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/data_parallel.py", line 70, in parallel_apply
    return parallel_apply(replicas, inputs, kwargs, self.device_ids[:len(replicas)])
  File "/home/k/miniconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/parallel_apply.py", line 67, in parallel_apply
    raise output
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'Sigmoid'

However when I remove the DataParallel wrapper, I get the precise stack-trace/error location:

  File "/home/k/miniconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 224, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/k/miniconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/container.py", line 67, in forward
    input = module(input)
  File "/home/k/miniconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 224, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/k/k/model.py", line 25, in forward
    x1 = F.Sigmoid(x1)

that's more helpful to debug

body:
When I use DataParallel, I get errors like:
```
 File "/home/k/miniconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 224, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/k/miniconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/data_parallel.py", line 60, in forward
    outputs = self.parallel_apply(replicas, inputs, kwargs)
  File "/home/k/miniconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/data_parallel.py", line 70, in parallel_apply
    return parallel_apply(replicas, inputs, kwargs, self.device_ids[:len(replicas)])
  File "/home/k/miniconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/parallel/parallel_apply.py", line 67, in parallel_apply
    raise output
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'Sigmoid'
```
However when I remove the DataParallel wrapper, I get the  precise stack-trace/error location:

```
  File "/home/k/miniconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 224, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/k/miniconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/container.py", line 67, in forward
    input = module(input)
  File "/home/k/miniconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 224, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/k/k/model.py", line 25, in forward
    x1 = F.Sigmoid(x1)
```
that's more helpful to debug
